meanings.definition: The action of stopping something from happening or arising.
meanings.sent1: Regular exercise is a good prevention against many health problems.
meanings.sent2: Fire alarms are important for the prevention of fires in buildings.
meanings.sent3: Wearing a cape to work might be an unusual prevention strategy against getting wet in the rain.
meanings.sent4: A strong immune system acts as a shield of prevention against illnesses.
meanings.sent5: The lock on the door serves as a barrier of prevention against intruders.

meanings.definition: The act of preventing something from occurring.
meanings.sent1: Vaccinations are a common prevention method for diseases.
meanings.sent2: Seat belts are a simple prevention measure to reduce injuries in car accidents.
meanings.sent3: Carrying an umbrella on a sunny day might seem like an odd prevention tactic against unexpected rain.
meanings.sent4: Education is a key prevention tool in reducing crime rates.
meanings.sent5: Wearing sunscreen is a vital prevention step to avoid sunburn.

meanings.definition: The practice of stopping something from happening.
meanings.sent1: Regular check-ups are part of the prevention of health issues.
meanings.sent2: Safety drills are a preventive practice for emergencies.
meanings.sent3: Using a banana peel as a slippery prevention method might lead to unexpected results.
meanings.sent4: Knowledge is a powerful prevention tool in avoiding mistakes.
meanings.sent5: Setting boundaries is an essential prevention technique in maintaining healthy relationships.
